articles.title: About this blog
articles.description: Some additional details about the blog

articles.title: Covid-19 Analysis: Afghanistan
articles.description: This blog contains an analysis on the no. of cases, recoveris and deaths in the year 2020 and 2021 for Afghanistan and a comparison of these numbers with the time before and after the on-going crises in Afghanistan.
articles.contents:
Contents
Introduction
Data Description
Data Source
Variable description

Analysis
Data Information Display
Analysis Communicaion

References

Introduction
Afghanistan is a country located in the south-central Asia. The country has been under a continuous conflict for 40 years and is again at war in 2021 itself. Before this it has been struggling with drought, hunger and along with it, the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) as well (Ghai, 2021).
Below, the analysis is focused on the COVID-19 numbers (cases and deaths) and its relation with the on-going crises.



Data Description



Data Source
The data set used in this blog has been extracted from World Health Organization-WHO. Which was in-turn collected by WHO via different sources. Till 21 March’20, WHO collected these numbers via official ministries of health websites, social media and through official communications under the International Health Regulations-IHR, 2005. From 22 March’20, WHO collected data through WHO dashboards and counts declared at the WHO headquarters regularly (WHO Coronavirus (COVID-19) Dashboard, 2021).
Variable description
The data set contains the data from January’20 to December’21. The variables used in the analysis are given below with their description and variable type:


Variables


Description


Type


Country


Country - Afghanistan


character


New_cases


New COVID-19 cases, calculated by subtracting ‘previous total cases before the date’ from ‘current total cases till date’


numeric


Cumulative_cases


Total COVID-19 cases till date


numeric


New_deaths


New COVID-19 deaths, calculated by subtracting ‘previous total deaths before the date’ from ‘current total deaths till date’


numeric


Cumulative_deaths


Total COVID-19 deaths till date


numeric


Year


Year of reporting to WHO


numeric


Month


Month of reporting to WHO


numeric
